shortcontents.shortcontent: I) Täʾamrä ʾIyäsus “Miracles of Jesus” (fols. 3ra-136va) I-1) ʾƎsäggǝd lä-mäläkotǝkä... “I worship Thy Godhead…” (fols. 3ra-5ra) I-2) Introduction (fols. 7ra-14va) - On John the Evangelist as the author of the book; on the creation and the fall of the angels (fols. 7ra-10rb) - Story of the family of Adam (fols. 10rb-14va) I-3) Täʾamrä ʾIyäsus “Miracles of Jesus”: 42 miracles (fols. 14va-136va).

copyists.copyist: The handwriting is similar, but not identical to that of AP-008 and AP-064.

donors.donor: Zä-Mikaʾel is mentioned in the supplication formulas in Texts I-2, I-3 (e.g., fols. 7ra, 24ra, 32va, 97va). Also, Wäldä Mikaʾel is mentioned (by mistake?) on fol. 97va . The donor seems to be the same as the one of Mss. AP-008 and AP-064.

txstates.txstate: The Ms. was resewn with recent threads of different type, e.g., fols. 7r, 19r, 27r, 51r, 59r, 83r. The cover is missing; traces of leather are visible on the inner face of the front board. The back board originates from a different codex. Quire IX (originally V) and quire XVI (originally XIV) are misplaced. Some fols. are damaged at the edges and centre folds by insects and rodents, e.g., fols. 1-6, 31-37, 127-136). Some fols. are stained with wax, e.g., fols. 47v-49v, 55r-59v. A few burn holes, e.g., fols. 56, 74, 76, 91, 85, 102 ,104, 105. A few holes or tears amended, on fols. 1, 33, 57, 124.

bindings.binding: Two wooden boards (probably re-utilized). Two pairs of sewing stations.

bnothers.bnother: Two pairs of rows of small holes are visible on the spine fold of the quires, close to the head and tail of the codex.

inks.ink: Black, red (vivid red, vivid vermillion, strong vermillion).

squires.squire:
A(2; s.l.: 1, no stub; 2, no stub/fols. 1r-2v) – I(4/fols. 3r-6v) – II(8/fol. 7r-14v) – ፪III(8/fols. 15r-22v) – ፫IV(8/fols. 23r-30v) – ፬V(8/fols. 31r -38v) – ፮VI(8/fols. 39r-46v) – ፯VII(8/fols. 47r-54v) – ፰VIII(8/fols. 55r-62v) – ፭IX(8/fols. 63r-70v) – ፱X(8/fols. 71r-78v) – ፲XI(8/fols. 79r-86v) –፲፩ XII(8; s.l.: 3, stub after 5; 6, stub after 2/fols. 87r-94v) – ፲፪XIII(8/fols. 95r - 102v) – ፲፫XIV(8/fols. 103r-110v) – ፲፭XV(8/fols. 111r-118v) – ፲፬XVI(8/fols. 119r-126v) – ፲፮XVII(10/fols. 127r-136v).
The two single leaves of quire A are sewn onto a strip of parchment. Quire IX (originally V) and quire XVI (originally XIV) are misplaced.

taunit.rl-info:
Ruling and pricking are visible. Primary pricks are partly visible. Ruling pricks are partly visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.
The ruling pattern are not regular: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/A (e.g., fol. 50). 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/B. (e.g., fol. 51). 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C (e.g., fol. 58).

rulings.ruling:
Ruling and pricking are visible. Primary pricks are partly visible. Ruling pricks are partly visible. Structural pricks are partly visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.
The ruling pattern are not regular: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/A (e.g., fol. 50). 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/B. (e.g., fol. 51). 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C (e.g., fol. 58).

pchangeofhands.pchangeofhand: It is difficult to determine whether one or more scribes were involved in writing. The handwriting changes from usually mediocre and irregular to careful and neat (e.g., fols. 7v/8r, 63rv, 100v/101r). Irregularities are e.g., - size of letters significantly differs, also within one column (cp., fols. 32vab, 82ra against 82vb); - space between letters significantly differs (cp., fols. 9vb against 10ra, 75v against 76r, 99vb); - occasionally the ruling was disregarded: text is written between lines, last ruling line is not used (cp., fols. 12ra-17vb). However, a few distinctive features appear, though not quite regularly throughout the entire Ms.: - ancient form of 'one' (፩, triangular upwards-oriented) - ancient form of 'six' (፮, looking like "compressed" number 'seven') - occasionally short hairlines extending horizontal elements of some letters (e.g. fol. 8ra: ሔ, ን እ, ይ, ደ, ገ) - the right loop of ሠ (in all vowel orders) is of smaller size.

rubrications.rubrication: Rubrication is executed in different tones of red: vivid red (e.g., fols. 3ra-4vb), vivid vermillion (e.g., fol. 15rb), strong vermillion (e.g., fol. 13rb); in some cases it differs even within one fol. (e.g., fols. 7r, 16r, 18r, 31r, 32v). It cannot be excluded that the rubrication was partly executed by a different hand. Nomina sacra and the name of the church Ṗäraqliṭos; incipit of Text I-1 (2 red lines alternating with black lines); incipit of Text I-2 (3 red lines above alternating with black lines, 2 red lines below) and its sections; incipit of Text I-3 and its numbers; words ʾǝsäggǝd, "I worship", mǝʿǝraf, "chapter" and its abbreviations; elements of the punctuation signs; elements of Ethiopic numerals. Lacunae for (rubricated) names occasionally not filled (e.g. fols. 47ra, 98va, 120ra).

abbreviations.abbreviation: ምዕ፡ for ምዕራፍ፡ (e.g., fols. 87va, 88va, 92vb, 83vb) ም፡ for ምዕራፍ፡ (e.g., fols. 82vb)

otherdetails.otherdetail: The miracles are numbered (except the 1st and 37th miracle).

additional.det: 91 ʾArke-hymns are scattered throughout the manuscript on fols. from 10r to 136r. The ʾArke on fol. 16r-v is partially washed out.

extras.extra: - The title of the work is written on the front board in yellow modern paint. - In the supplication formulas the säbʾa Betä Ṗäraqliṭos "people of Betä Ṗäraqliṭos" are most often mentioned, contrary to the donor Zä-Mikaʾel, who is mentioned only occasionally. - Numerous passages referring to the text are written in the upper margin, occasionally erased and re-written: e.g., fol. 61r. - Lacunae: fols. 66ra, 66vb. - Pen trial: fols. 6v, 125v. - Some erased or crossed out words/passages: e.g., fols. 20ra, 49rb, 53vb, 89va, 90rb, 91va [several lines], 95vb, 98rb 105va. - A few corrections written over erased words and passages: e.g., fols. 45vb, 75vb, 98ra, 100rb, 103va, 122va [19 lines]. - Drawings of crosses: fol. 2r, 6v, in pen and ink. - Minor notes and writing exercises: fols. 2r, 6r.

txquiremarks.txquiremark: Decorated quire marks are written in the left upper corner of the first fol. of the quire: fols. 15r, 31r, 39r, 47r, 55r, 63r, 71r, 79r, 87r, 95r, 111r, 119r, 127r.

txfindingaids.txfindingaid: (Coloured) threads inserted in the upper corner of fols. 47, 79, 109, for navigating the text.

drawing.details: Legend: ቤተ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ ቤተ፡ ጰራቅሊጦስ፡ አነ፡ ገብረ፡ ዋህድ፡ ሰዓልክዋ፡ "I, Gäbrä Wahǝd, painted the church of Betä Ṗäraqliṭos". The legend is followed by Gäbrä Wahǝd's signature.
